alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 12 at 8:53AM PDT until April 13 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures of 29 to 34 with light winds will result in frost formation. Least threat of frost will be across the inner Portland and Vancouver urban areas. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area, Central Willamette Valley and South Willamette Valley. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 10 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures appear to briefly reach freezing close to sunrise, however, they will stay below 35 degrees for several hours. Areas shaded from early morning sun will be slower to warm up.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; South Willamette Valley
